page.title: 07 B.B. 1
page.content: B.B. is a famous author living in Sudborough.He has written many of his books about the Northamptonshire area,e.g"Wild Lone", the story of a Pytchley fox. He now lives in Sudborough in the Toll House which is a round house dating from the 17th century(1660). B.B. also illustrates his own books under the psuedonym of D.J.Watkins-Pitchford. He wrote many of his books in the 30s and 40s. He taught art at Rugby school between 1931 and 1949. B.B. studied at the Royal Collage of Arts under Rothersleh as well as studying in Paris. He now spends much of his time painting portraits of nature subjects. This is seen in many of his books.He won a Carnegie Medal in 1942 for his book the Little Grey Men.
